with spicy tomato rice kind of like
Spanish rice only you know not in Spain
so it's just spicy tomato rice very easy
recipe very delicious
so take some butter melt in a pan add
some regular long grain rice by the way
the heat is on medium low here to that
we're going to add some diced jalapeno
we're going to chop the bottoms of a
green onion save the tops for the
garnish and some garlic
how much go to the site the ingredients
are there all right give that a stir
into the butter we're going to coat the
grains of rice with the butter we're
going to add some chili powder we're
going to add some Chipotle some cumin
and some salt all right we're going to
give that a mix and once that's all
nicely coated and the spices have kind
of warmed up a little bit in that oil we
are going to add our chicken stock some
tomato sauce just plain tomato sauce and
we're going to bring that to a simmer
cover it and simmer it on low for 20
minutes
then turn off the heat leave a cover for
eight minutes don't peek
after eight minutes it's going to look
like that you're going to fluff it with
a fork which is the key because if you
leave it you're going to give them a big
lump all right in Spanish they call it a
lump oh so what you want to do is you
want to fluff it with a fork that
releases the steam we're going to dump
that on a serving platter and there's
the perfect texture you want a little
bit of stickiness a little bit of
tackiness you want the grains of rice to
kind of stick together but you want them
to be also at the same time separate all
right separate yet together throw some
chopped green onions on top and serve it
with a food really nice side dish change
of pace very delicious you got to give
